task.title: Addition Operation Using Windows Calculator
task.shortdesc: This topic describes how to add two numbers using the Windows Calculator (Standard mode).

taskbody.prereq: There are two prerequisites for this task. Firstly, you should be aware of the basic arithmetic function of Addition. Secondly, you should be familiar with how to access the Windows Calculator and open it in the Standard mode. For more information, refer to the topic— "Accessing Windows Calculator".

step.cmd: Open the Windows Calculator in the Standard mode. It should display the number zero (0) in the display section, as shown in the following figure.

Enter the first number. You may either enter the number using your keyboard or use your mouse to click on the appropriate numeric button(s) on the Calculator. The number shows up in the display area, as shown in the following figure. (In our example case, let the first number be 5.)

fig.title: Addition Using Windows Calculator— First Number Entry

step.cmd: Click on the Plus (+) button in the Calculator as highlighted in the figure below. Alternatively, you may press the Plus (+) button on the numeric key pad of your keyboard.

fig.title: Addition Using Windows Calculator— Clicking on the Plus Button

step.cmd: Now, enter the second number. This is similar to adding the first number. The figure below highlights the second number. (In our example case, let it be 12.)

fig.title: Addition Using Windows Calculator— Second Number Entry

step.cmd: Next, click the Equal To (=) button on the Calculator. This is highlighted in the figure below. Alternatively, you may also press the Equal To (=) button on the numeric keypad of your keyboard.

fig.title: Addition Using Windows Calculator— Clicking on the 'Equal To' Button

step.stepresult: The sum of the two numbers now appears in the display area, as shown in the figure below. (In our example case, the sum is— (5 + 12) = 17.) Addition Using Windows Calculator— Arriving at the Sum

step.cmd: Once you are done with the Addition operation, you may close the Calculator by clicking the Close icon () in the top right corner of the Calculator app.
